abstracts.cdata!:
The Structural Adjustment Credit for the
            Federal Republic of Yugoslavia, Republic of Serbia supports
            the governments of the Federal Republic of Yugoslavia (FRY)
            and its larger constituent republic, the Republic of Serbia,
            in the implementation of a structural reform agenda with the
            main objective of enhancing medium-term fiscal
            sustainability as a basis for sustained growth and poverty
            reduction. The reform program to be supported by the
            operation works to achieve these objectives through
            implementating specific reforms in the areas of: 1) public
            expenditure management; 2) the energy sector; and 3) social
            protection and labor; and 4) the health care sector. The SCA
            works to solidify the stabilization and reform progress made
            thus far in FRY and Serbia, and provide a basis for building
            a more comprehensive program. By targeting the sources of
            macroeconomic imbalance, the SAC will enhance the
            effectiveness the World Bank portfolio and other
            donors' programs. The credit will also send an
            important signal to donors and private investors and
            creditors, and thereby help stimulate much needed official
            support and private investments. Given the importance of
            developments in FRY to the overall prospects for Southeast
            Europe, this credit for stabilization and recovery in FRY
            will also have important effects to the region as a whole.
